resources.string: Shows up when you need to start Phoenix.
Tells you when Phoenix needs to be started to settle a payment.
Shows up when Phoenix cannot receive a payment because of a liquidity issue.
Shows up when you receive a payment while the app is in the background.
Tells you when Phoenix is running in the background.
Tells you when a swap is going to timeout.

Contact support by email for assistance
Enter your 12-words recovery to unlock the wallet.\n\nWords must be entered in the correct order, and separated with a single space.
Enter the complete seed to proceed further.
This seed is not valid. Make sure the words are correct and in order.
An error occurred. Please try again.
This seed does not match your wallet.
This QR code is a classic Bitcoin address.\n\nIt can be read by almost any Bitcoin service/wallet, but payments will be slower to arrive.
Could not generate a bitcoin address

This QR code is a Lightning invoice.

Lightning payments are very fast and usually cheaper, but some wallets and services may not support them yet.

In that case, swipe to the right to get a regular Bitcoin address.
Enter a description for this invoice
This is not a valid amount.
This amount is below the requested amount of %1$s.

The invoice for this payment does not request a specific amount. This may be exploited by malicious nodes during the payment.\n\nTo be safe, ask the recipient to specify an amount when generating the invoice.
On-chain transactions are typically slower and best suited for large payments.
Lightning payments are fast and best suited for small payments.
Uses an effective feerate of %1$s sat/vbyte.
Scan a QR code containing a payment request, a Bitcoin address or a LNURL
Enter a Lightning invoice, LNURL or Lightning address you want to send money to.
This field must be an integer
The wallet does not have any channels that are eligible for closing.
This address uses a different blockchain
%1$d channel(s) have been closed. You can find the details in the home screen.
Balance is the aggregated balance of your active channels. It\'s what you can spend over Lightning.
Inbound liquidity is what your channels can receive over Lightning without having to go on-chain and pay fees.
You don\'t have any channels yet.\n\nA new payment channel will be created automatically when needed.
No active channel exists for that identifier.
This screen is a debugging tool that can be used to manually import encrypted channels data.\n\nUse with caution.
Data are malformed. A encrypted hex blob is expected.
Data could not be decrypted by this wallet.
Use the Receive and Send buttons at the bottom of this screen to get started!
BIP39 seed with standard BIP84 derivation path
Error: logs could not be exported
Payment must be paid to decrypt the message.
You can attach a note to this payment.
This payment happened following a conflict in a channel.
Add a custom description to this payment
Recipient is not reachable, or does not have enough inbound liquidity.
Payment rejected by the recipient.\nThis usually occurs when the invoice has already been paid or when it contains an expiration date, and you attempted to send a payment after the expiration.
No route found with current fee setting. Try with higher fees.
No suitable authentication hardware on this device.
The biometric hardware is not available. Try again later.
Please enroll a PIN/Schema/Fingerprint in Android first.
The hardware is unsafe. An Android security update is required.
Not supported by this version of Android.
Too many attempts, try again later.
This version of Android is not compatible.
Lock access to the app with Android\'s screen lock/fingerprint
Phoenix authenticates with a key unique to %1$s. This unique key becomes your password for your account there.
The service will not have access to your wallet whatsoever. They cannot see your balance, payments, or keys.
Phoenix uses a non-standard scheme on this service to be compatible with older versions of the app. The associated account will not be portable to other wallets.
Network error. Check your internet connection and try again.
An unknown error occurred. Try again.
Use a standard scheme compliant with the LNURL specifications. This is the recommended option for new wallets, and what the Phoenix iOS app uses.
Use a legacy scheme to connect to accounts created with the old Phoenix Android app.

The service %1$s responded with an error:

%2$s

Contact their support if needed.
The service %1$s returned an HTTP error (%2$s).\n\nContact their support if needed.
The service %1$s returned a malformed message.
You can attach a message to the payment. This message will be sent to the recipient.
The invoice returned by %1$s does not use the same chain as your wallet.
The invoice returned by %1$s has already been paid.
The invoice returned by %1$s has an incorrect amount.
The invoice returned by %1$s is malformed.

To secure your payment channels Phoenix monitors the Bitcoin blockchain through Electrum servers.\n\nBy default, random servers are used. You can also configure Phoenix to connect only to your own server.
Use the plain TCP port, not the TLS one, since this is an onion service.
You are using a custom server
This server provided an unknown certificate. Connection is rejected.
Connections to the Lightning network and Electrum servers will be protected.
Are you sure you want to disable Tor?
Are you sure you want to enable Tor? Note that for best result, it\'s recommended to start a new wallet as well.
The Tor proxy is not started yet.
The Tor proxy is shutdown.\nPlease wait and check your Internet connection.
Note that the Tor network is an open project running on donations. It can sometimes be very slow, which will affect the app\'s performances.
The app will not function correctly until all connections are established.
Your device has no Internet connection. The app will not function properly.\n\nPlease check your device\'s setting.
Your invoices will use this description by default. You can override it on a case-by-case basis.
Invoices that you create are stale after this delay. Default value is 1 week.
Export your local successful payments in CSV (comma separated value) format.
Please pick a valid start/end date
You will pay %1$s to the Bitcoin miners
Phoenix was unable to retrieve the current state of the mempool and cannot estimate the speed of your transactions.\n\nCheck the mempool manually on an explorer, and use a adequate value!
Unable to create a new commitment
Cannot start transaction session with the peer
A splice payment is already in progress
Delete all wallet data from this device
This will reset the app, as if you had just installed it.
The wallet will be completely deleted from this device.
This will reset the app. Your payments history will be lost. You will be taken to the Intro screen, and prompted to create or restore a wallet.
You are responsible for storing your recovery phrase.
The wallet has been successfully reset.
